Salesforce analytics from Tableau FAQ
What do you mean by Salesforce analytics from Tableau?
Salesforce analytics refers to a portfolio of analytics products delivered primarily through the Tableau brand, including
Tableau
,
CRM Analytics
,
Embedded Analytics
,
Tableau Pulse,
Customer Data Cloud for Tableau,
and an ever-expanding lineup of
visual analytics tools
.
What is Tableau?
Tableau is the leading analytics and
business intelligence
(BI) platform from Salesforce that enables everyone to make better, faster business decisions. A powerful visual-analytics platform, Tableau transforms how individuals and organizations use
data and insights
to solve problems.
How can Tableau help me?
Tableau can take data from almost any system—including your Salesforce CRM instance—and provide quick, actionable insights. With the flexibility to deploy on-prem or in the cloud and scale across your organization, Tableau enables everyone to make
data-driven decisions
and better serve customers. And with the integrations of AI,
Tableau
Accelerators,
and
Customer 360
, you can get started fast and stay in the flow of work.
What is the difference between Tableau and CRM Analytics?
CRM Analytics and Tableau are complementary products from Salesforce. Select the right product for your organization by determining where your users need to see their insights.
Tableau is an end-to-end
analytics platform
for a broad range of
enterprise use cases
.
